topic.title: Greenplum Environment Variables
topic.shortdesc: Reference of the environment variables to set for Greenplum Database.

body.p: Set these in your user's startup shell profile (such as ~/.bashrc or ~/.bash_profile), or in /etc/profile if you want to set them for all users.

topic.title: Optional Environment Variables

body.p: The following are standard PostgreSQL environment variables, which are also recognized in Greenplum Database. You may want to add the connection-related environment variables to your profile for convenience, so you do not have to type so many options on the command line for client connections. Note that these environment variables should be set on the Greenplum Database master host only.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGAPPNAME

body.p: The name of the application that is usually set by an application when it connects to the server. This name is displayed in the activity view and in log entries. The PGAPPNAME environmental variable behaves the same as the application_name connection parameter. The default value for application_name is psql. The name cannot be longer than 63 characters.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGDATABASE

body.p: The name of the default database to use when connecting.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGHOST

body.p: The Greenplum Database master host name.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGHOSTADDR

body.p: The numeric IP address of the master host. This can be set instead of or in addition to PGHOST to avoid DNS lookup overhead.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGPASSWORD

body.p: The password used if the server demands password authentication. Use of this environment variable is not recommended for security reasons (some operating systems allow non-root users to see process environment variables via ps). Instead consider using the ~/.pgpass file.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGPASSFILE

body.p: The name of the password file to use for lookups. If not set, it defaults to ~/.pgpass. See the topic about The Password File in the PostgreSQL documentation for more information.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGOPTIONS

body.p: Sets additional configuration parameters for the Greenplum Database master server.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGPORT

body.p: The port number of the Greenplum Database server on the master host. The default port is 5432.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGUSER

body.p: The Greenplum Database user name used to connect.

topic.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
topic.title: PGDATESTYLE

body.p: Sets the default style of date/time representation for a session. (Equivalent to SET datestyle TO...)

topic.title: PGTZ

body.p: Sets the default time zone for a session. (Equivalent to SET timezone TO...)
